title: Lean Startup Methodology
description: The Lean Startup is a methodology that uses validated learning cycles and minimum viable products to reduce product development risk. This approach emphasizes rapid iteration and customer feedback over extensive upfront planning.

title: Platform Business Model
description: Platform businesses create value by connecting two or more groups and facilitating interactions between them. Examples include Uber (drivers and riders) and Airbnb (hosts and guests). Key success factors include network effects and strong governance.

title: Subscription Model Economics
description: Subscription models create predictable recurring revenue streams. They require strong customer retention strategies and continuous value delivery. Key metrics include Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) and Customer Lifetime Value (CLV).

title: MVP Strategy
description: A Minimum Viable Product is the smallest version of a product that delivers core value to customers. MVPs allow startups to validate assumptions quickly with minimal resources. They form the basis for iterative product development.

title: Unit Economics
description: Unit economics measures the viability of individual business transactions. Key metrics include customer acquisition cost (CAC) and lifetime value (LTV). A healthy ratio is typically LTV:CAC of 3:1 or better.
